medical_history.chief_complaint: Gradual and worsening abdominal pain, moving to the right lower quadrant.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient was in his typical state of health when he developed abdominal pain several hours ago. The pain gradually worsened from periumbilical to generalized, eventually localizing to the right lower quadrant. The pain is described as crampy and dull and has not been relieved by any measures. He has experienced chills but no nausea, vomiting, or fevers.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Diverticulosis; previous surgical history includes umbilical hernia repair (without mesh) and removal of a non-adenomatous polyp during colonoscopy.
medical_history.family_history: Denies family history of gastrointestinal disorders; mother had colon cancer.
